definitions: The quality of sound being deep, full, and reverberating.
The reinforcement or prolongation of sound by reflection or by the synchronous vibration of a neighboring object.
The ability of a system or device to resonate or be in tune with external vibrations.
A relationship of mutual understanding or affinity.
examples: The resonance of the deep voice.
The piano's resonance filled the room.
The concept found resonance with many in the community.
